clinical_study.brief_title: Transversus Abdominis Plane Block In Children
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Ultrasonography Guided Transversus Abdominis Plane Block to Intraoperative Anesthesia in Children: Randomized Controlled Study

brief_summary.textblock: Aim of this study; Intra-operative anesthesia and analgesia effects of Transversus Abdominis Plane Block supported by ketamine sedation only.

primary_outcome.measure: the amount of anesthetic drug which was used

arm_group.description: Transversus Abdominis Plane block after ketamine atropine induction and continued with ketamine only in anesthesia

After ketamine atropine induction, a laryngeal mask was inserted and anesthesia administration was continued with 2 sevoflurane MAC and oxygen / air mixture and applied Transversus Abdominis Plane block.

After ketamine atropine induction, a laryngeal mask was inserted and anesthesia administration was continued with 2 sevoflurane MAC and oxygen / air mixture and Non-block, postoperative analgesia with paracetamol IV

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ASA I-II
- To undergo elective lower abdominal surgery
- between 2-6 years old
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with psychiatric disease
- Patients whose weight is more than 40 kg
- Patients with cardiac-pulmonary-neurological disease
- Patients with bleeding disorder
- Patients with infection or scar on the injection area
- Patients with known allergies to local anesthetics
